content: Checkboxes allow users to select one or more items. Key states include `isDisabled`, `isIndeterminate` (for a mixed selection state), and `lineThrough` for a strikethrough effect on the label.
Checkboxes can be styled with various `sizes`, `colors`, and `radius` options. The check icon can also be replaced with a custom component passed to the `icon` prop.
A Checkbox can be a controlled component. Use the `isSelected` prop to set its state and the `onValueChange` event to handle changes.
The Checkbox has several stylable slots: `base` (the main wrapper), `wrapper` (inner container), `icon`, and `label`. These can be customized using the `classNames` prop.
For advanced customization, you can use the `useCheckbox` hook to build a completely custom implementation while retaining the core logic and accessibility features.
The Checkbox is built on a native HTML `<input>` element, ensuring full browser and assistive technology support. It handles keyboard events (Tab, Space) and has proper ARIA attributes.
